Medical Clinic of Houston is a fantastic facility with a stellar reputation. My Physician, Dr. Magid is incredible in that he is extremely professionally astute with regards to current medical research. He also willingly and consistently takes the time to write handwritten notes to follow up with patients to explain their health status after tests are completed. Even the parking attendants are warm and personable.
The two receptionists/billing agents in radiology, however, appear to cut off the personable atmosphere by spouting out scripted instructions in a way that demonstrates a complete disconnect with the human experience. The two who were on staff at 3pm on 5/3 were unable to make one second of eye contact with me as they quickly barked out orders of "change down there and wait here, etc. I thought it was my sole perception until the next patient wondered down the hall looking as confused as was I about the dressing room instructions. Sounds small, but appears to be a hugely different institution on that floor, shutting down the wonderful professional interaction prior to arriving at reception on the 1st floor.
I love Dr. Magid & staff but there is never enough handicapped parking on 1st floor! I am on oxygen & then is a problem for me!

Good doctor but terrible staff and administration. My husband went in for an annual physical exam and they ran routine blood tests. We weren't informed of any other additional tests being performed but we received a bill to the amount of $115. No explanations. When we contacted our insurance they informed us of the doctor's office running additional blood work not covered under routine annual physical. When I called, the staff was least helpful. We weren't informed why those tests were being performed nor why we weren't informed at the time of the tests. Better find another clinic where they don't treat patients as customers and are genuinely concerned about their health. I will not recommend Medical Clinic of Houston.
Dr. Magid is a first rate internist. He is prompt, thorough, thoughtful, a great communicator, and a superb diagnostician.
Dr Magid is an incredibly smart and knowledgeable doctor. His quick wit and funny bedside manner makes going to the dr enjoyable.

I have been a patient of Dr. Magid's for several years and have recommended him to family and friends. He is the BEST doctor I have ever been to; he is compassionate, funny, and truly committed to providing the best care possible. Everyone should be so lucky as to have him as their doctor!!!!

This doctor is by far the BEST doctor I have even been to. As other posters have stated: he will not give up on finding your problem. He has the patience of a saint. He is the type of doctor that I drive over 45 minutes to see- just because the quality of care is that good. I would absolutely without a doubt recommend Dr. Magid to anyone.

He is funny and laid back, not to mention smart, smart, smart. You will leave his office with answers you understand, unlike some places that practically shove you out after the HMO mandated 3.5 minutes. I recommend him to anyone who is afraid of doctors, he will make you laugh and feel safe.

Dr. Juarez is outstanding!!!! I have been a diabetic for 20 years. She listened and gave me great advice. Her medical diagnoses and recommendations guided me towards improved health. Dr. Juarez and her staff gave the BEST customer service. I would highly recommend Dr. Juarez.

My experience with Dr. Juarez was...interesting to say the least. My first appointment went well. She was listening to some of the concerns I had. After taking my blood testing she went up on my dosage. When I went back for my second visit , my blood results had not changed much, she asked me if I had been taking my medicine and when I said yes she said "Well, I'm not going to say you are lying but the blood results show otherwise"......excuse me? Why would I lie about taking my medication when I KNOW my blood results will show if I have been taking it. She kept me on the same dosage despite my complaints that I wasn't feeling better. I stayed on that medication for 2 more months until I took another blood test and the results were the EXACT SAME. She upped my dosage again and I still wasn't feeling as good as I know I can and should. When I went to my next appointment I tried to talk to her about a few natural options to help control my thyroid levels (since I would like to try and get pregnant soon) she would barely even let the words come out of my mouth. She even refused to listen to some of my symptoms and told me they weren't symptoms of my illness, although I know for a fact they are. At that point I completely stopped going to her. I found a new endocrinologist from lots of recommendations from others I know suffering from hypothyroidism. I'm hoping I will have a better experience and actually have a dr. who likes to listen to their patients and treat them like human beings!

I don't know where I would be without her. Praise God for this doctor.

Please fire Maria and the other useless staff there. I hear amazing things about Dr. Salvato, but it is completely ruined by her rude and unprofessional staff. I struggle with chronic fatigue and really need a grear physician to help me, but it's impossible to even schedule an appointment. Maria is a terrible person to deal with new patients. Please just get rid of her, and hire somebody who actually cares and wants to do good work.

I never had the chance to even see Dr. Salvato, so I am not rating her as a doctor. I am simply writing to express my disappointment in her staff, particularly Maria in billing. I booked this new patient appt 3 mos ago. The day before my appt at 345 (they close at 5), I noticed that I had a missed call on my cell phone. I call the number back and talk to Maria, who informs me that my insurance is "inactive" and that the PCP name is not Dr. Salvato. I tell her that no, that's not correct, I have the cards, and it says Dr. Salvato right on it. She continues to tell me that it is inactive , so I tell her that I have to call BCBS, but by this time it is 448, and there is no way I can get this resolved before they close at 5. She tells me that once I get it resolved that I can let them know at my appt. I call a supervisor at BCBS and let them know what 's going on and we get it resolved. There is a mishap with the premium and Healthcare.gov screwed up my premium payment , so it shows that I owe more than I do. I have to send in an appeal to get this resolved. But because it still shows that I owe more on my premium payment,. Today, after I drove in from Katy and explained this to a very unfriendly Maria, she said that I cannot use my insurance because it's a 50/50 chance that it won't get paid. I put BCBS supervisor Jason on the phone with her to assure her that this claim will be paid, and she still refuses me. I took the day off without pay for this appt. If I would have been advised of this even a few days before the appt, I could've gotten this resolved. She was the most unfriendly person I have had to deal with and basically I left feeling like this office cares more about $ than patient care. I am hoping that this whole inconvenience and terrible treatment is a blessing in disguise and that I am meant to find a doctor office who cares about patients and helping them instead of doing the opposite. Dr. Salvato may be a great doctor, but I will never have the chance to find out, as I am never stepping foot in that office again. Btw, it is a good thing that I decided to call back the missed call #, because she didn't even leave a message, or try to call my home #.

Dr Salvato has been my Doctor for over 15 years. She is very caring and has helped me so much with my fibromyalgia. I ask my current doctor here to talk with her and she was able to explain to him where I was with my meds and various diagnoses. My brother recently went to her and he has been very impressed. after reviewing all the symptoms and looking at the blood test, she determined he had Rocky Mountain spotted fever and has been treating him. In summary, I feel like she is a superb Doctor. The office seems a bit disorganized at times. I think because they are just so busy and also they have student physician assistants there. That would be my only complaint.

He has, in my opinion, the most friendly and knowledgeable inpatient care. I found myself in and out of Kindred Hospital because of the reoccurring condition of both heels and the infection in my foot. Each time I was admitted for IV therapy that usually ran approximately 3-6 weeks, I was immediately under the care of Dr. Loya. Whatever the situation or complication of the IV therapy took place, Dr. Loya was right there making modified changes in medication to correct or better the condition. Anytime I had a question, Dr. Loya was right there to answer them to my satisfaction. At the end of each hospital stay he would talk with me, making sure that if I had any questions he would answer them. Doctors in general tend to have education in his field, but Dr. Loya exceeded those situations. He is the most compassionate, friendly, knowledgable, professional doctor that I have ever met. Genuinely, I would not do ratings or reviews or even suggest a situation, or in this case, doctors, to other people., but for Dr. Loya I will. Anyone I come into contact with, I would and will, not have any problem whatsoever suggesting they ask for Dr. Munir Loya as a physician. He has always made my stay here at Kindred warm and peaceful with kind words. I would shake his hand each year upon my discharge from the Kindred hospital system. I don't look forward to coming into a hospital on a repeat basis, but when conditions are such where I would have to be readmitted I would make sure it would be Kindred Clear Lake where I know I will be under his care.

Dr. Loya is a professional doctor. He helps in any way that he can. He is a team player and listens to me. Dr. Bui and her staff were some of the nicest folks I've ever dealt with. Promptness and great attitudes were always present. While I no longer use her services as I moved out of Houston, I would recommend her to anyone.
